concept.title: Enabling Solutions for Core Services
concept.shortdesc: To enable solutions for Marketing Cloud Profiles and Audiencs are enabled by using an updated Marketing Cloud ID (MACID) service (formerly Visitor ID), along with several other modernization steps.

conbody.note: Raw analytics data collected in the real-time audiences framework does not recognize the IP obfuscation available for Adobe Analytics customers. Customers who currently use IP obfuscation in Analytics are encouraged to review their data collection and privacy policies before requesting real-time audience enablement to avoid violating these policies.

SKUs (Latest AN SKU, Target Standard recommended)

section.title: Use DTM to Implement the Marketing Cloud ID

ol.li: If you are not using DTM, implement the MACID as part of your Analytics deployment.

section.title: Request access to Audiences (provisioning)
section.p: Follow up with what you can do now that you're enabled.

section.title: Verify that you have an Analytics solution SKU.
section.p: You must have the Adobe Analytics Solution SKU (not the legacy SiteCatalyst SKU). The Analytics Solution SKU became available in 2013.
You must also have an Adobe Target Solution SKU (Target Standard, Target Premium, or Target Classic).

section.title: Contact Adobe to opt-in.
section.p: Complete the Adobe Marketing Cloud Interface Opt-In Application.

Completing the form notifies the Adobe Customer Provisioning Team (CPT) to provision your account. Then, the CPT notifies the Account Manager you specified on the form. Your Account Manager then contacts you.
Once enabled as an administrator, you can access the Tools page in the Marketing Cloud, where you can:

ul.li: Invite users to the Marketing Cloud
Link solution accounts to Adobe IDs, which enables single sign-on

section.p:
See
for information about administrating the Marketing Cloud.

section.title: Verify that you are on Regional Data Collection Service (RDC)
section.p: If your data collection domain is omtrdc.net, or if your CNAME is mapped to omtrdc.net, you are on RDC.
If you are using first-party cookies, see CNAME and the Visitor ID Service.

section.title: Configure the Marketing Cloud ID service
section.p: Perform the following JavaScript implementation steps and update specified implementation files:

li.p: Implement the Marketing Cloud ID Service Implementation.
Perform the steps described in the JavaScript Deployment (VisitorAPI.js) table in Marketing Cloud ID Service Implementation.
Update your existing s_code to version H.27 or later, or your existing AppMeasurement.js to version 1.3 or later.
These files are available for download in the Code Manager.
If necessary, see the Analytics Implementation reference guide for information about a JavaScript implementation.

section.title: Start using Analytics for Target reporting
section.p: Refresh the mbox.js implementation for Target (version 48 or later).

section.title: Request access to the audience service
section.p: Complete the Audiences Services Access Request form.

section.title: Share audiences to the Marketing Cloud
section.p: The Marketing Cloud Audience Services is the interface that lets you create audiences, combine existing audiences to create composite audiences, and view all shared audiences.

section.title: Upload and share customer attributes to the Marketing Cloud
section.p: If you capture enterprise data in a customer resource management (CRM) database, you can upload the data into a customer attribute data source in the Marketing Cloud.
